tactics.name: Initial Access
tactics.description: The adversary is trying to get into your network.

tactics.name: Execution
tactics.description: The adversary is trying to run malicious code.

tactics.name: Persistence
tactics.description: The adversary is trying to maintain their foothold.

tactics.name: Privilege Escalation
tactics.description: The adversary is trying to gain higher-level permissions.

tactics.name: Defense Evasion
tactics.description: The adversary is trying to avoid being detected.

tactics.name: Credential Access
tactics.description: The adversary is trying to steal account names and passwords.

tactics.name: Discovery
tactics.description: The adversary is trying to figure out your environment.

tactics.name: Lateral Movement
tactics.description: The adversary is trying to move through your environment.

tactics.name: Collection
tactics.description: The adversary is trying to gather data of interest to their goal.

tactics.name: Exfiltration
tactics.description: The adversary is trying to steal data.

tactics.name: Command and Control
tactics.description: The adversary is trying to communicate with compromised systems to control them.

tactics.name: Impact
tactics.description: The adversary is trying to manipulate, interrupt, or destroy your systems and data.

techniques.name: Phishing
techniques.description: Adversaries may send phishing messages to gain access to victim systems.

techniques.name: Valid Accounts
techniques.description: Adversaries may steal the credentials of a specific user or service account.

techniques.name: External Remote Services
techniques.description: Adversaries may leverage external-facing remote services to gain initial access.

techniques.name: User Execution
techniques.description: An adversary may rely upon specific actions by a user.

techniques.name: Command Line Interface
techniques.description: Adversaries may use command-line interfaces to interact with systems.

techniques.name: Scripting
techniques.description: Adversaries may use scripts to aid in operations.

techniques.name: Scheduled Task
techniques.description: Adversaries may abuse task scheduling functionality to facilitate execution.

techniques.name: Create Account
techniques.description: Adversaries may create an account to maintain access to victim systems.

techniques.name: Exploitation for Privilege Escalation
techniques.description: Adversaries may exploit software vulnerabilities to elevate privileges.

techniques.name: Bypass User Account Control
techniques.description: Adversaries may bypass UAC to elevate process privileges.

techniques.name: Disable Security Tools
techniques.description: Adversaries may disable security tools to avoid detection.

techniques.name: Indicator Removal
techniques.description: Adversaries may delete or modify artifacts to remove evidence.

techniques.name: Brute Force
techniques.description: Adversaries may attempt to access accounts by guessing passwords.

techniques.name: Credential Dumping
techniques.description: Adversaries may attempt to extract credentials from the OS.

techniques.name: Keylogging
techniques.description: Adversaries may log user keystrokes to intercept credentials.

techniques.name: Account Discovery
techniques.description: Adversaries may try to get a listing of accounts on a system.

techniques.name: Network Service Scanning
techniques.description: Adversaries may scan for services to identify entry points.

techniques.name: File and Directory Discovery
techniques.description: Adversaries may enumerate files and directories.

techniques.name: Remote Services
techniques.description: Adversaries may use remote services to access other systems.

techniques.name: Internal Spearphishing
techniques.description: Adversaries may spearphish from compromised internal accounts.

techniques.name: Pass the Hash
techniques.description: Adversaries may perform pass-the-hash attacks.

techniques.name: Screen Capture
techniques.description: Adversaries may attempt to capture screenshots.

techniques.name: Archive Collected Data
techniques.description: Adversaries may compress data to make exfiltration more efficient.

techniques.name: Automated Exfiltration
techniques.description: Adversaries may exfiltrate data at specific times or intervals.

techniques.name: Exfiltration Over C2
techniques.description: Adversaries may steal data by sending it over C2 channel.

techniques.name: Web Service
techniques.description: Adversaries may use web services for C2 communications.

techniques.name: Proxy
techniques.description: Adversaries may use a proxy to hide the source of traffic.

techniques.name: Data Destruction
techniques.description: Adversaries may destroy data to disrupt availability.

techniques.name: Service Stop
techniques.description: Adversaries may stop services to disrupt system operations.

techniques.name: Network Denial of Service
techniques.description: Adversaries may attempt to deny availability to network resources.
